page.title: 04WITHINGTON EDUCATION
page.content: Withington has a village school which is situated opposite the church. The school began as a{National School}in 1857.It is a{Church of England Aided {Primary School}for children aged from 4 years to 11 years with 32 children on roll at present. The children are taught in two classes an infant class of nineteen children and a junior class of thirteen children. The buildings consist of 2 classrooms a kitchen and a school house in which there is a library, computer station, office and music room. Half of the children have school meals which are prepared in the schools own kitchen, the remainder bring packed lunches. This year two children won silver medals in the{Cheltenham Open Festival for verse speaking and plying the recorder.
